item.title: collect
item.description: Table of Contents collect command reference Examples Output Default ToDo statement format in code collect command reference Name Short Long Description Remark Status Multiple Path -p --path The path from which to start traversal. None stable no Workers -w --workers The amount of workers (threads) used when parsing the collected files.

item.title: Installation
item.description: Table of Contents Installation The Rust way (via cargo) The Arch way via AUR (with yay): The AppImage way (x86_64 example): The Docker way Installation Installing senile can be done on numerous ways. The Rust way (via cargo) cargo install senile The Arch way via AUR (with yay): yay -S senile The AppImage way (x86_64 example): curl -fSsL https://github.com/replicadse/senile/releases/latest/download/AppImage.x86_64.tar.gz > senile.

item.title: ToDos
item.description: Table of Contents ToDos min ToDos senile uses itself in it’s build pipeline. These are the currently open ToDos in the project itself: min prio: aw assignee: min body: Wow, it actually works! context: ` fn main() → Result<(), Box<dyn Error>> { ` file: ./src/main.rs line: 21
